title: CRUNCH-698: Inclusion of local patch for AVRO-2944
body: Fixes [AVRO-2944](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AVRO-2944) where Avro's static method for creating a DataFileReader instance can get stuck in an infinite loop while trying to read the 4 byte "magic" header of the file. More details can be found at [CRUNCH-698](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRUNCH-698).

title: CRUNCH-696 update FormatBundle.readFields() compatibility
body:
Make FormatBundle.readFields() compatible with FormatBundles serialized
with an older version of Crunch.  This ensures jobs don't fail during an
upgrade to a cluster-provided Crunch dependency.  Without this some jobs
get submitted without the filesystem field in the serialized
FormatBundle and then encounter EOFException when the job gets
scheduled to run and uses the newer Crunch to deserialize the FormatBundle.

title: CRUNCH-695: Fix NullPointerException in RegionLocationTable
body: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRUNCH-695

title: CRUNCH-693: Make text parsing locale-independent
body:
Standardize on US-based locale for number formatting (which is
backwards-compatible with historical behavior).

title: The great version upgrade PR
body: In order to stay in sync w/our primary upstream dependencies, I bit the bullet and made all of the changes required to make Crunch work against Hadoop 2.8.2 and (hopefully) later. It's a large set of small/no-op changes, but version dependency changes like this are always sort of spicy so I'll get some eyes on it before I push it in.

title: CRUNCH-688: Fix HFile node affinity for non-default namespace HBase t
body: ables

title: CRUNCH-683 avoid unnecessary listStatus() calls from getPathSize()
body: Since @jonhemphill has been tied up in other things and hasn't been able to complete #23, I'm throwing this out to try to wrap it up.

title: CRUNCH-685 Use whitelist and blacklist for .fileSystem() properties
body:
Addresses [CRUNCH-685](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRUNCH-685) by introducing whitelist and blacklist configs that control which FileSystem config properties are merged into the FormatBundle.

Also adds logging to make it more transparent as to what is going on.

title: CRUNCH-684: Fix .equals and .hashCode for Targets
body: Previously the `equals` and `hashCode` methods for the `Target` implementations Crunch provides did not consider all available information when determining uniqueness. `FileTargetImpl` only used the path, and `HBaseTarget` only the table name. This could result in situations where a target was silently ignored because of how a `Set` is used in various places for holding a pipeline's collection of targets. For HBase especially, the `hbase.zookeeper.quorum` configuration if supplied can change where the table actually resides.

title: CRUNCH-683 Avoid unnecessary listStatus calls from getPathSize computation
CRUNCH-681: Updating HFileUtils to accept a filesystem parameter for
body:
targets and sources

Follow-up change that we missed in [CRUNCH-677](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CRUNCH-677) - the creation of HFileSource and HFileTarget instances in HFileUtils should support usage of a supplied FileSystem instance.

title: CRUNCH-680: Kafka Source should split very large partitions
body: Introduces relatively straightforward logic to chunk very large partitions into multiple splits. Some missing unit tests were also added in.

title: CRUNCH-679: Improvements for usage of DistCp
CRUNCH-677 Source and Target accept FileSystem
body:
The change to Source, Target, and SourceTarget obviously breaks compatibility for implementors of these interfaces as we're still building against Java 7 so I can't provide a default implementation for these new methods.

Also, there is an expectation that Target implementations will need to update the asSourceTarget() method to copy the FileSystem along.

title: Suggested code changes from Coverity inspection
body:
See https://scan.coverity.com/projects/1983

These should be small uncontroversial changes. Look at the hashCode-related change though, in case it's important to retain the exact partitioning across releases.

(Does this need a JIRA?)

title: Enforce crunch.max.reducers in all cases
Speed up multi-file source construction and reduce jobconf bloat
body: Currently every individual file is appended to jobconf individually with serialized schema, i.e., duplicating the schema for every file. For a couple of thousands of files this takes several minutes and bloats the jobconf triggering "Exceeded max jobconf size" exception.

title: CRUNCH-293: Add AvroMode to inject avro readers.
body: This PR includes the cleaned-up AvroMode changes discussed on CRUNCH-293. Tests are passing.
